meanings.definition: To strike or lash with a bullwhip.
meanings.sent1: The cowboy bullwhipped the ground to scare away the cattle.
meanings.sent2: The trainer bullwhipped the lion to make it perform tricks.
meanings.sent3: The bullwhipped rope cracked loudly in the air, making the audience jump.
meanings.sent4: Her words bullwhipped through the silence, leaving a mark on everyone present.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the bullwhipped leather echoed through the canyon.

meanings.definition: Having been beaten or punished severely with a bullwhip.
meanings.sent1: The bullwhipped prisoner bore scars from the cruel punishment.
meanings.sent2: The bullwhipped horse cowered in fear at the sight of the whip.
meanings.sent3: Despite his bullwhipped appearance, he still had a determined spirit.
meanings.sent4: Her bullwhipped confidence slowly began to heal with time.
meanings.sent5: The bullwhipped rug lay tattered on the floor, a reminder of past discipline.
